meanings.definition: A type of fish found in New Zealand waters.
meanings.sent1: The hoki swam gracefully in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy eating hoki for dinner.
meanings.sent3: Why did the hoki refuse to play cards? Because it was afraid of the sharks!
meanings.sent4: The hoki glided through the water like a silver arrow.
meanings.sent5: The hoki's silvery scales shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To return or go back to a previous place.
meanings.sent1: After the long journey, we hoki to our cozy home.
meanings.sent2: I need to hoki to the store to get some milk.
meanings.sent3: The lost puppy decided to hoki back to its owner.
meanings.sent4: Memories hoki to me like waves crashing on the shore.
meanings.sent5: I hoki to the familiar smell of freshly baked cookies.

meanings.definition: A type of tree native to New Zealand.
meanings.sent1: The hoki tree provided shade on hot summer days.
meanings.sent2: The leaves of the hoki tree rustled in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The birds built their nests in the branches of the hoki.
meanings.sent4: The hoki tree stood tall and proud in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the hoki tree flowers filled the air.
